justification: "Next, we collected data on mood in the past month (PANAS-Past)… (Watson et al., 1988)" indicates that past-month affect was assessed with the PANAS Past questionnaire.
The methods note that "momentary mood scores (PANAS-Present-Before … PANAS-Present-After)" were obtained, showing that current affect was measured with the Present version of PANAS.
Participants completed "personality attributes of motivated behavior (BIS/BAS) (Carver and White, 1994)", linking the BIS/BAS scales to this construct.
The protocol states they measured "predisposition to develop hopelessness (BHS) (Beck et al., 1974)", tying hopelessness to the BHS instrument.
After the experiment, participants performed "a working memory task (OSPAN) (Turner and Engle, 1989)", indicating OSPAN was used to gauge working memory capacity.

"We calculated the Pavlovian performance index (PPI)… These indices represent the likelihood to initiate actions towards rewards and inhibit responses when facing potential loss"—showing PPI operationalizes Pavlovian bias.
"After each block, participants rated their perceived levels of success… using two visual analogue scales", linking the construct of perceived success to a VAS.
The same sentence notes participants also rated "control" on a visual analogue scale, thus measuring perceived controllability with a VAS.
